to engrave; inscribed motto
гравировать; надписанный девиз
rtega_mnemonic:
銘銘RS
铭铭		inscribe, engrave, unforgettably
  • name 名 engraved in a metal 金 door sign
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 铭)
Ideographic: To carve 釒 one's name 名; 名 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
銘記 [ míng jì ]: to engrave in one's memory
銘刻 [ míng kè ]: a carved inscription
銘文 [ míng wén ]: inscription
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 名 [ míng ] name; position, rank, title
heisig_chinese_memo: A piece of metal with a name on it. Well, this is basically the definition of inscription.
heisig_constituent: inscription, metal, gold, name, evening, mouth
heisig_story: Take inscription in the sense of the name you ask the jeweler to carve on a gold bracelet or inside a gold ring to identify its owner or communicate some sentimental message. It will help if you can recall the first time you had this done and the feelings you had at the time.
koohiiStory1: A piece of metal with a name on it. Well, this is basically the definition of inscription.
koohiiStory2: I imagine ancient Egyptian inscriptions: Pharaohs´ names written in gold.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A gold name on this piece of wood is the inscription that shows the artist's signature.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: This inscription refers to a signature or something similar. This is an artisan's signature in the form of an inscription.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The inscription is a name written on something, right? Remember the kanji for "name"? It is 名, and it shares the reading with this kanji as well, making both names めい.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If you need to review 名 go ahead and do that. It will help you to remember this kanji.
Ru_Russian: надпись, отметка <small>(в т.ч. авторская на изделии, торговая марка и т.п.)</small>
Ru_Words:
銘めい
  • надпись (на памятнике), подпись (на клинке меча, на вазе и т. п.)
  • наименование
  • изречение, девиз, лозунг
    • warodai
    銘じるめいじる
  • запечатлеваться, записываться
    • 銘柄めいがら
  • акции (товары), котирующиеся на бирже
  • торговый знак, торговая марка
    • warodai
    銘々めいめい
  • каждый в отдельности
    • 銘記するめいきする
  • запечатлевать, отмечать (в сердце, в памяти)
    • 記銘きめい
  • надпись, гравировка
    • warodai
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the name (名) in gold (金) is an inscription
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Any piece of gold given as a present usually has a name inscription on it.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription means the text carved on the artifact, that is, the inscription. 𠫑Qiang Zhong: "The Ming is used in the Ming." Zhongshan Wang Ding: "Zhongshan King □ swindle (make) the Ding Yu Ming.

"Said Wen": "Men, remember. From Jin's reputation."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from " gold " from " name ", " name " is a sound symbol. " Ming " has the meaning of name and name. In ancient times, one's own name or clan emblem was often inscribed on utensils. Therefore, " Ming " from " Name " has an ideographic component in addition to the sound.
humanum_full_description:
金文表示鑄刻在器物上的文字，即銘文。𠫑羌鐘：「用明則之于銘。」中山王鼎：「中山王□詐(作)鼎于銘曰。」

　　《說文》：「銘，記也。从金名聲。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「金」從「名」，「名」是聲符。「名」有名叫、名字之意，古代常常在器物上銘刻自己的名字或族徽，故「銘」從「名」除表音以外，還有表意的成分。

銘銘RS
铭铭 		inscribe, engrave, unforgettably
  • name 名 engraved in a metal 金 door sign
(Simplified: 铭)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: To carve 釒 one's name 名; 名 also provides the pronunciation
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 名 [ míng ] name; position, rank, title
①鑄、刻或寫在器物上記述生平、事蹟或警誡自己的文字：銘刻。銘文。銘志。墓誌銘。座右銘。
②在器物上刻字，表示紀念，永誌不忘：銘記。銘心。銘骨。銘諸肺腑(喻永記)。
③中國古代用於銘刻的文字逐步形成的一種文體，如《文心雕龍》有《銘箴》篇。
銘記 [ míng jì ]: to engrave in one's memory
銘刻 [ míng kè ]: a carved inscription
銘文 [ míng wén ]: inscription

銘々(めいめい): each, individual

金文表示鑄刻在器物上的文字，即銘文。𠫑羌鐘：「用明則之于銘。」中山王鼎：「中山王□詐(作)鼎于銘曰。」 《說文》：「銘，記也。从金名聲。」
Bronze inscription means the text carved on the artifact, that is, the inscription. 𠫑Qiang Zhong: "The Ming is used in the Ming." Zhongshan Wang Ding: "Zhongshan King □ swindle (make) the Ding Yu Ming. "Said Wen": "Men, remember. From Jin's reputation."

銘字的基本解释

銘
míng
见“铭”。

銘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［míng］
［《廣韻》莫經切，平青，明。］
“铭1”的繁体字。亦作“名2”。
(1)记载；镂刻。
(2)刻写在器物上的文辞。
(3)指刻写有文辞的碑版。
(4)文体的一种。古代常刻于碑版或器物，或以称功德，或用以自警。
(5)铭记，永志不忘。
(6)铭旌。

銘字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　銘； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1305第07
【唐韻】莫經切【集韻】【韻會】忙經切，?音冥。【說文】記誦也。【集韻】志也。【釋名】銘，名也，記名其功也。【又】述其功美，使可稱名也。【禮·祭統】夫鼎有銘。銘者，自名也，自名以稱揚其先祖之美，而明著之後世者也。【註】銘，謂書之刻之，以識事者也。【禮·大學】湯之盤銘曰。【註】銘，銘其器以自警之詞也。　又【禮·檀弓】銘，明旌也。【周禮·春官·小祝】設熬置銘。【註】銘，今書或作名。鄭云：銘，書死者名于旌。

銘字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
銘字的起名意思

暂无。

Ming
Basic explanation of words
Ming
míng
See "Ming".
Ming
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［míng］
["Guangyun" Mo Jingqie, Pingqing, Ming. ]
Traditional characters of "铭1". Also known as "Name 2".
(1) Record; engraved.
(2) The words written on the utensils.
(3) Refers to the stele plate with words written on it.
(4) A type of style. In ancient times, it was often engraved on tablets or artifacts, either as merit or self-warning.
(5) Remember, never forget.
(6) Ming Jing.
Ming
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 Ming; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 1305 Page 07
[Tang Yun] Mo Jing Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Busy Jing Qi,? Yin Ming. 【Said Wen】Recite also. [Ji Yun] Zhi Ye. 【Release Name】Ming, name and merit. 【Also】State their merits and beauty, so that they can be named. 【Ritual and Sacrifice】Fu Ding has inscriptions. The name of the inscriber has his own name, to praise the beauty of his ancestors, and he who knows the future generations. [Note] Inscription, that is, the engraving of the book, the one who knows things. [Rite·University] Yuzhipan Ming said. [Note] Ming, Ming Qiqi is also a word of self-warning.　[Li·Tan Gong] Ming, Ming Jing. 【Zhou Li·Chun Guan·Xiao Zhu】Set the inscription. [Note] Ming, this book or name. Zheng Yun: Ming, the name of the deceased is Yu Jing.

míng
вм. 铭
Radicals: 金, 名  (gold, name)
Meaning Mnemonic
A gold name on this piece of wood is the inscription that shows the artist's signature.
This inscription refers to a signature or something similar. This is an artisan's signature in the form of an inscription.
Reading Mnemonic
The inscription is a name written on something, right? Remember the kanji for "name"? It is 名, and it shares the reading with this kanji as well, making both names めい.
If you need to review 名 go ahead and do that. It will help you to remember this kanji.
